byline.original: By MERNA THOMAS and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Egyptian court acquits 17 people who had been charged with illegally protesting after they witnessed police killing of poet Shaimaa el-Sabbagh during peaceful march in January.
lead_paragraph: The charges and unexpected acquittals underscored the increasingly capricious nature of Egypt’s justice system under its military-backed government.

headline.main: Egyptian Court Acquits 17 in Case Arising From Poet’s Death at March
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Court Acquits 17 in Case Arising From Poet’s Death at March

snippet: The charges and unexpected acquittals underscored the increasingly capricious nature of Egypt’s justice system under its military-backed government.
